                     <div class="line">Why do you make us love your goodly gifts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And snatch them straight away? We here below</div>
                     <div class="line">Recall not what we give, and therein may</div>
                     <div class="line">Use honour with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYCHORIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience, good sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even for this charge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, mild may be thy life!</div>
                     <div class="line">For a more blustrous birth had never babe:</div>
                     <div class="line">Quiet and gentle thy conditions! for</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art the rudeliest welcome to this world</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever was prince's child. Happy what follows!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast as chiding a nativity</div>
                     <div class="line">As fire, air, water, earth, and heaven can make,</div>
                     <div class="line">To herald thee from the womb: even at the first</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy loss is more than can thy portage quit,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all thou canst find here. Now, the good gods</div>
                     <div class="line">Throw their best eyes upon't!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Sailors</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">What courage, sir? God save you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Courage enough: I do not fear the flaw;</div>
                     <div class="line">It hath done to me the worst. Yet, for the love</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this poor infant, this fresh-new sea-farer,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would it would be quiet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">Slack the bolins there! Thou wilt not, wilt thou?</div>
                     <div class="line">Blow, and split thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">But sea-room, an the brine and cloudy billow kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">the moon, I care not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, your queen must overboard: the sea works high,</div>
                     <div class="line">the wind is loud, and will not lie till the ship be</div>
                     <div class="line">cleared of the dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">That's your superstition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon us, sir; with us at sea it hath been still</div>
                     <div class="line">observed: and we are strong in custom. Therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">briefly yield her; for she must overboard straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">As you think meet. Most wretched queen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYCHORIDA</div>
                     <div class="line">Here she lies, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">A terrible childbed hast thou had, my dear;</div>
                     <div class="line">No light, no fire: the unfriendly elements</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgot thee utterly: nor have I time</div>
                     <div class="line">To give thee hallow'd to thy grave, but straight</div>
                     <div class="line">Must cast thee, scarcely coffin'd, in the ooze;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, for a monument upon thy bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">And e'er-remaining lamps, the belching whale</div>
                     <div class="line">And humming water must o'erwhelm thy corpse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lying with simple shells. O Lychorida,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid Nestor bring me spices, ink and paper,</div>
                     <div class="line">My casket and my jewels; and bid Nicander</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring me the satin coffer: lay the babe</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the pillow: hie thee, whiles I say</div>
                     <div class="line">A priestly farewell to her: suddenly, woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit LYCHORIDA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, we have a chest beneath the hatches, caulked</div>
                     <div class="line">and bitumed ready.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee. Mariner, say what coast is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">We are near Tarsus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thither, gentle mariner.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alter thy course for Tyre. When canst thou reach it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Sailor</div>
                     <div class="line">By break of day, if the wind cease.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, make for Tarsus!</div>
                     <div class="line">There will I visit Cleon, for the babe</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot hold out to Tyrus: there I'll leave it</div>
                     <div class="line">At careful nursing. Go thy ways, good mariner:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bring the body presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE II.  Ephesus. A room in CERIMON's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CERIMON, with a Servant, and some Persons who
have been shipwrecked</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Philemon, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PHILEMON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILEMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth my lord call?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Get fire and meat for these poor men:</div>
                     <div class="line">'T has been a turbulent and stormy night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been in many; but such a night as this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till now, I ne'er endured.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Your master will be dead ere you return;</div>
                     <div class="line">There's nothing can be minister'd to nature</div>
                     <div class="line">That can recover him.</div>
                     <p>To PHILEMON</p>
                     <div class="line">Give this to the 'pothecary,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell me how it works.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but CERIMON</p>
               <p>Enter two Gentlemen</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow to your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do you stir so early?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our lodgings, standing bleak upon the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shook as the earth did quake;</div>
                     <div class="line">The very principals did seem to rend,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all-to topple: pure surprise and fear</div>
                     <div class="line">Made me to quit the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the cause we trouble you so early;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not our husbandry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you say well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">But I much marvel that your lordship, having</div>
                     <div class="line">Rich tire about you, should at these early hours</div>
                     <div class="line">Shake off the golden slumber of repose.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis most strange,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature should be so conversant with pain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being thereto not compell'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold it ever,</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue and cunning were endowments greater</div>
                     <div class="line">Than nobleness and riches: careless heirs</div>
                     <div class="line">May the two latter darken and expend;</div>
                     <div class="line">But immortality attends the former.</div>
                     <div class="line">Making a man a god. 'Tis known, I ever</div>
                     <div class="line">Have studied physic, through which secret art,</div>
                     <div class="line">By turning o'er authorities, I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with my practise, made familiar</div>
                     <div class="line">To me and to my aid the blest infusions</div>
                     <div class="line">That dwell in vegetives, in metals, stones;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I can speak of the disturbances</div>
                     <div class="line">That nature works, and of her cures; which doth give me</div>
                     <div class="line">A more content in course of true delight</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to be thirsty after tottering honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or tie my treasure up in silken bags,</div>
                     <div class="line">To please the fool and death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Your honour has through Ephesus pour'd forth</div>
                     <div class="line">Your charity, and hundreds call themselves</div>
                     <div class="line">Your creatures, who by you have been restored:</div>
                     <div class="line">And not your knowledge, your personal pain, but even</div>
                     <div class="line">Your purse, still open, hath built Lord Cerimon</div>
                     <div class="line">Such strong renown as time shall ne'er decay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two or three Servants with a chest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">So; lift there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">What is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, even now</div>
                     <div class="line">Did the sea toss upon our shore this chest:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis of some wreck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Set 't down, let's look upon't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis like a coffin, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Whate'er it be,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis wondrous heavy. Wrench it open straight:</div>
                     <div class="line">If the sea's stomach be o'ercharged with gold,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a good constraint of fortune it belches upon us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis so, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">How close 'tis caulk'd and bitumed!</div>
                     <div class="line">Did the sea cast it up?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">I never saw so huge a billow, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">As toss'd it upon shore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Wrench it open;</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! it smells most sweetly in my sense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">A delicate odour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">As ever hit my nostril. So, up with it.</div>
                     <div class="line">O you most potent gods! what's here? a corse!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Most strange!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Shrouded in cloth of state; balm'd and entreasured</div>
                     <div class="line">With full bags of spices! A passport too!</div>
                     <div class="line">Apollo, perfect me in the characters!</div>
                     <p>Reads from a scroll</p>
                     <div class="line">'Here I give to understand,</div>
                     <div class="line">If e'er this coffin drive a-land,</div>
                     <div class="line">I, King Pericles, have lost</div>
                     <div class="line">This queen, worth all our mundane cost.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who finds her, give her burying;</div>
                     <div class="line">She was the daughter of a king:</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides this treasure for a fee,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods requite his charity!'</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou livest, Pericles, thou hast a heart</div>
                     <div class="line">That even cracks for woe! This chanced tonight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Most likely, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, certainly to-night;</div>
                     <div class="line">For look how fresh she looks! They were too rough</div>
                     <div class="line">That threw her in the sea. Make a fire within:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch hither all my boxes in my closet.</div>
                     <p>Exit a Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">Death may usurp on nature many hours,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet the fire of life kindle again</div>
                     <div class="line">The o'erpress'd spirits. I heard of an Egyptian</div>
                     <div class="line">That had nine hours lien dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who was by good appliance recovered.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter a Servant, with boxes, napkins, and fire</p>
                     <div class="line">Well said, well said; the fire and cloths.</div>
                     <div class="line">The rough and woeful music that we have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cause it to sound, beseech you.</div>
                     <div class="line">The viol once more: how thou stirr'st, thou block!</div>
                     <div class="line">The music there!--I pray you, give her air.</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen.</div>
                     <div class="line">This queen will live: nature awakes; a warmth</div>
                     <div class="line">Breathes out of her: she hath not been entranced</div>
                     <div class="line">Above five hours: see how she gins to blow</div>
                     <div class="line">Into life's flower again!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">The heavens,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through you, increase our wonder and set up</div>
                     <div class="line">Your fame forever.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">She is alive; behold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eyelids, cases to those heavenly jewels</div>
                     <div class="line">Which Pericles hath lost,</div>
                     <div class="line">Begin to part their fringes of bright gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">The diamonds of a most praised water</div>
                     <div class="line">Do appear, to make the world twice rich. Live,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make us weep to hear your fate, fair creature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rare as you seem to be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>She moves</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">O dear Diana,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where am I? Where's my lord? What world is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not this strange?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Most rare.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Hush, my gentle neighbours!</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend me your hands; to the next chamber bear her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Get linen: now this matter must be look'd to,</div>
                     <div class="line">For her relapse is mortal. Come, come;</div>
                     <div class="line">And AEsculapius guide us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt, carrying her away</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE III.  Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PERICLES, CLEON, DIONYZA, and LYCHORIDA with
MARINA in her arms</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Most honour'd Cleon, I must needs be gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">My twelve months are expired, and Tyrus stands</div>
                     <div class="line">In a litigious peace. You, and your lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take from my heart all thankfulness! The gods</div>
                     <div class="line">Make up the rest upon you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Your shafts of fortune, though they hurt you mortally,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet glance full wanderingly on us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">O your sweet queen!</div>
                     <div class="line">That the strict fates had pleased you had brought her hither,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have bless'd mine eyes with her!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot but obey</div>
                     <div class="line">The powers above us. Could I rage and roar</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth the sea she lies in, yet the end</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be as 'tis. My gentle babe Marina, whom,</div>
                     <div class="line">For she was born at sea, I have named so, here</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge your charity withal, leaving her</div>
                     <div class="line">The infant of your care; beseeching you</div>
                     <div class="line">To give her princely training, that she may be</div>
                     <div class="line">Manner'd as she is born.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not, my lord, but think</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace, that fed my country with your corn,</div>
                     <div class="line">For which the people's prayers still fall upon you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must in your child be thought on. If neglection</div>
                     <div class="line">Should therein make me vile, the common body,</div>
                     <div class="line">By you relieved, would force me to my duty:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if to that my nature need a spur,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods revenge it upon me and mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the end of generation!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I believe you;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your honour and your goodness teach me to't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without your vows. Till she be married, madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">By bright Diana, whom we honour, all</div>
                     <div class="line">Unscissor'd shall this hair of mine remain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though I show ill in't. So I take my leave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good madam, make me blessed in your care</div>
                     <div class="line">In bringing up my child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have one myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who shall not be more dear to my respect</div>
                     <div class="line">Than yours, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, my thanks and prayers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll bring your grace e'en to the edge o' the shore,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then give you up to the mask'd Neptune and</div>
                     <div class="line">The gentlest winds of heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will embrace</div>
                     <div class="line">Your offer. Come, dearest madam. O, no tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lychorida, no tears:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to your little mistress, on whose grace</div>
                     <div class="line">You may depend hereafter. Come, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE IV.  Ephesus. A room in CERIMON's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CERIMON and THAISA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, this letter, and some certain jewels,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay with you in your coffer: which are now</div>
                     <div class="line">At your command. Know you the character?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">It is my lord's.</div>
                     <div class="line">That I was shipp'd at sea, I well remember,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even on my eaning time; but whether there</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver'd, by the holy gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot rightly say. But since King Pericles,</div>
                     <div class="line">My wedded lord, I ne'er shall see again,</div>
                     <div class="line">A vestal livery will I take me to,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never more have joy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, if this you purpose as ye speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">Diana's temple is not distant far,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you may abide till your date expire.</div>
                     <div class="line">Moreover, if you please, a niece of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall there attend you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">My recompense is thanks, that's all;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet my good will is great, though the gift small.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. [Prologue]</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE III.  Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE IV</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.7">6. SCENE V.  Mytilene. A street before the brothel.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VI.  The same. A room in the brothel.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. [Prologue]</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GOWER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOWER</div>
                     <div class="line">Imagine Pericles arrived at Tyre,</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcomed and settled to his own desire.</div>
                     <div class="line">His woeful queen we leave at Ephesus,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto Diana there a votaress.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now to Marina bend your mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom our fast-growing scene must find</div>
                     <div class="line">At Tarsus, and by Cleon train'd</div>
                     <div class="line">In music, letters; who hath gain'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Of education all the grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which makes her both the heart and place</div>
                     <div class="line">Of general wonder. But, alack,</div>
                     <div class="line">That monster envy, oft the wrack</div>
                     <div class="line">Of earned praise, Marina's life</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeks to take off by treason's knife.</div>
                     <div class="line">And in this kind hath our Cleon</div>
                     <div class="line">One daughter, and a wench full grown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even ripe for marriage-rite; this maid</div>
                     <div class="line">Hight Philoten: and it is said</div>
                     <div class="line">For certain in our story, she</div>
                     <div class="line">Would ever with Marina be:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be't when she weaved the sleided silk</div>
                     <div class="line">With fingers long, small, white as milk;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or when she would with sharp needle wound</div>
                     <div class="line">The cambric, which she made more sound</div>
                     <div class="line">By hurting it; or when to the lute</div>
                     <div class="line">She sung, and made the night-bird mute,</div>
                     <div class="line">That still records with moan; or when</div>
                     <div class="line">She would with rich and constant pen</div>
                     <div class="line">Vail to her mistress Dian; still</div>
                     <div class="line">This Philoten contends in skill</div>
                     <div class="line">With absolute Marina: so</div>
                     <div class="line">With the dove of Paphos might the crow</div>
                     <div class="line">Vie feathers white. Marina gets</div>
                     <div class="line">All praises, which are paid as debts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not as given. This so darks</div>
                     <div class="line">In Philoten all graceful marks,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Cleon's wife, with envy rare,</div>
                     <div class="line">A present murderer does prepare</div>
                     <div class="line">For good Marina, that her daughter</div>
                     <div class="line">Might stand peerless by this slaughter.</div>
                     <div class="line">The sooner her vile thoughts to stead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lychorida, our nurse, is dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">And cursed Dionyza hath</div>
                     <div class="line">The pregnant instrument of wrath</div>
                     <div class="line">Prest for this blow. The unborn event</div>
                     <div class="line">I do commend to your content:</div>
                     <div class="line">Only I carry winged time</div>
                     <div class="line">Post on the lame feet of my rhyme;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which never could I so convey,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless your thoughts went on my way.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dionyza does appear,</div>
                     <div class="line">With Leonine, a murderer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DIONYZA and LEONINE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy oath remember; thou hast sworn to do't:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but a blow, which never shall be known.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not do a thing in the world so soon,</div>
                     <div class="line">To yield thee so much profit. Let not conscience,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is but cold, inflaming love i' thy bosom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Inflame too nicely; nor let pity, which</div>
                     <div class="line">Even women have cast off, melt thee, but be</div>
                     <div class="line">A soldier to thy purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will do't; but yet she is a goodly creature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">The fitter, then, the gods should have her. Here</div>
                     <div class="line">she comes weeping for her only mistress' death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art resolved?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am resolved.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MARINA, with a basket of flowers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I will rob Tellus of her weed,</div>
                     <div class="line">To strew thy green with flowers: the yellows, blues,</div>
                     <div class="line">The purple violets, and marigolds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall as a carpet hang upon thy grave,</div>
                     <div class="line">While summer-days do last. Ay me! poor maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Born in a tempest, when my mother died,</div>
                     <div class="line">This world to me is like a lasting storm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whirring me from my friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Marina! why do you keep alone?</div>
                     <div class="line">How chance my daughter is not with you? Do not</div>
                     <div class="line">Consume your blood with sorrowing: you have</div>
                     <div class="line">A nurse of me. Lord, how your favour's changed</div>
                     <div class="line">With this unprofitable woe!</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, give me your flowers, ere the sea mar it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Walk with Leonine; the air is quick there,</div>
                     <div class="line">And it pierces and sharpens the stomach. Come,</div>
                     <div class="line">Leonine, take her by the arm, walk with her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I pray you;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not bereave you of your servant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come;</div>
                     <div class="line">I love the king your father, and yourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">With more than foreign heart. We every day</div>
                     <div class="line">Expect him here: when he shall come and find</div>
                     <div class="line">Our paragon to all reports thus blasted,</div>
                     <div class="line">He will repent the breadth of his great voyage;</div>
                     <div class="line">Blame both my lord and me, that we have taken</div>
                     <div class="line">No care to your best courses. Go, I pray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Walk, and be cheerful once again; reserve</div>
                     <div class="line">That excellent complexion, which did steal</div>
                     <div class="line">The eyes of young and old. Care not for me</div>
                     <div class="line">I can go home alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will go;</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet I have no desire to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, I know 'tis good for you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Walk half an hour, Leonine, at the least:</div>
                     <div class="line">Remember what I have said.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant you, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll leave you, my sweet lady, for a while:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, walk softly, do not heat your blood:</div>
                     <div class="line">What! I must have a care of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">My thanks, sweet madam.</div>
                     <p>Exit DIONYZA</p>
                     <div class="line">Is this wind westerly that blows?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">South-west.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was born, the wind was north.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Was't so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">My father, as nurse said, did never fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">But cried 'Good seaman!' to the sailors, galling</div>
                     <div class="line">His kingly hands, haling ropes;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, clasping to the mast, endured a sea</div>
                     <div class="line">That almost burst the deck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">When was this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was born:</div>
                     <div class="line">Never was waves nor wind more violent;</div>
                     <div class="line">And from the ladder-tackle washes off</div>
                     <div class="line">A canvas-climber. 'Ha!' says one, 'wilt out?'</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a dropping industry they skip</div>
                     <div class="line">From stem to stern: the boatswain whistles, and</div>
                     <div class="line">The master calls, and trebles their confusion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, say your prayers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">What mean you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">If you require a little space for prayer,</div>
                     <div class="line">I grant it: pray; but be not tedious,</div>
                     <div class="line">For the gods are quick of ear, and I am sworn</div>
                     <div class="line">To do my work with haste.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why will you kill me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">To satisfy my lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why would she have me kill'd?</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, as I can remember, by my troth,</div>
                     <div class="line">I never did her hurt in all my life:</div>
                     <div class="line">I never spake bad word, nor did ill turn</div>
                     <div class="line">To any living creature: believe me, la,</div>
                     <div class="line">I never kill'd a mouse, nor hurt a fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">I trod upon a worm against my will,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I wept for it. How have I offended,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein my death might yield her any profit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or my life imply her any danger?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">My commission</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not to reason of the deed, but do it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">You will not do't for all the world, I hope.</div>
                     <div class="line">You are well favour'd, and your looks foreshow</div>
                     <div class="line">You have a gentle heart. I saw you lately,</div>
                     <div class="line">When you caught hurt in parting two that fought:</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sooth, it show'd well in you: do so now:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your lady seeks my life; come you between,</div>
                     <div class="line">And save poor me, the weaker.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sworn,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will dispatch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He seizes her</p>
               <p>Enter Pirates</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Pirate</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, villain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>LEONINE runs away</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Pirate</div>
                     <div class="line">A prize! a prize!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Pirate</div>
                     <div class="line">Half-part, mates, half-part.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let's have her aboard suddenly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Pirates with MARINA</p>
               <p>Re-enter LEONINE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONINE</div>
                     <div class="line">These roguing thieves serve the great pirate Valdes;</div>
                     <div class="line">And they have seized Marina. Let her go:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no hope she will return. I'll swear</div>
                     <div class="line">she's dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thrown into the sea. But I'll see further:</div>
                     <div class="line">Perhaps they will but please themselves upon her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not carry her aboard. If she remain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom they have ravish'd must by me be slain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Pandar, Bawd, and BOULT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Boult!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Search the market narrowly; Mytilene is full of</div>
                     <div class="line">gallants. We lost too much money this mart by being</div>
                     <div class="line">too wenchless.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">We were never so much out of creatures. We have but</div>
                     <div class="line">poor three, and they can do no more than they can</div>
                     <div class="line">do; and they with continual action are even as good as rotten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore let's have fresh ones, whate'er we pay for</div>
                     <div class="line">them. If there be not a conscience to be used in</div>
                     <div class="line">every trade, we shall never prosper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sayest true: 'tis not our bringing up of poor</div>
                     <div class="line">bastards,--as, I think, I have brought up some eleven--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, to eleven; and brought them down again. But</div>
                     <div class="line">shall I search the market?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">What else, man? The stuff we have, a strong wind</div>
                     <div class="line">will blow it to pieces, they are so pitifully sodden.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sayest true; they're too unwholesome, o'</div>
                     <div class="line">conscience. The poor Transylvanian is dead, that</div>
                     <div class="line">lay with the little baggage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, she quickly pooped him; she made him roast-meat</div>
                     <div class="line">for worms. But I'll go search the market.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Three or four thousand chequins were as pretty a</div>
                     <div class="line">proportion to live quietly, and so give over.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Why to give over, I pray you? is it a shame to get</div>
                     <div class="line">when we are old?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">O, our credit comes not in like the commodity, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">the commodity wages not with the danger: therefore,</div>
                     <div class="line">if in our youths we could pick up some pretty</div>
                     <div class="line">estate, 'twere not amiss to keep our door hatched.</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, the sore terms we stand upon with the gods</div>
                     <div class="line">will be strong with us for giving over.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, other sorts offend as well as we.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">As well as we! ay, and better too; we offend worse.</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither is our profession any trade; it's no</div>
                     <div class="line">calling. But here comes Boult.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BOULT, with the Pirates and MARINA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To MARINA</span>  Come your ways. My masters, you say</div>
                     <div class="line">she's a virgin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Pirate</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, we doubt it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, I have gone through for this piece, you see:</div>
                     <div class="line">if you like her, so; if not, I have lost my earnest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Boult, has she any qualities?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">She has a good face, speaks well, and has excellent</div>
                     <div class="line">good clothes: there's no further necessity of</div>
                     <div class="line">qualities can make her be refused.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">What's her price, Boult?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot be bated one doit of a thousand pieces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pandar</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, follow me, my masters, you shall have your</div>
                     <div class="line">money presently. Wife, take her in; instruct her</div>
                     <div class="line">what she has to do, that she may not be raw in her</div>
                     <div class="line">entertainment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Pandar and Pirates</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Boult, take you the marks of her, the colour of her</div>
                     <div class="line">hair, complexion, height, age, with warrant of her</div>
                     <div class="line">virginity; and cry 'He that will give most shall</div>
                     <div class="line">have her first.' Such a maidenhead were no cheap</div>
                     <div class="line">thing, if men were as they have been. Get this done</div>
                     <div class="line">as I command you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Performance shall follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack that Leonine was so slack, so slow!</div>
                     <div class="line">He should have struck, not spoke; or that these pirates,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not enough barbarous, had not o'erboard thrown me</div>
                     <div class="line">For to seek my mother!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Why lament you, pretty one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am pretty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, the gods have done their part in you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I accuse them not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">You are light into my hands, where you are like to live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">The more my fault</div>
                     <div class="line">To scape his hands where I was like to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and you shall live in pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, indeed shall you, and taste gentlemen of all</div>
                     <div class="line">fashions: you shall fare well; you shall have the</div>
                     <div class="line">difference of all complexions. What! do you stop your ears?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you a woman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">What would you have me be, an I be not a woman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">An honest woman, or not a woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, whip thee, gosling: I think I shall have</div>
                     <div class="line">something to do with you. Come, you're a young</div>
                     <div class="line">foolish sapling, and must be bowed as I would have</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods defend me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">If it please the gods to defend you by men, then men</div>
                     <div class="line">must comfort you, men must feed you, men must stir</div>
                     <div class="line">you up. Boult's returned.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter BOULT</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, sir, hast thou cried her through the market?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">I have cried her almost to the number of her hairs;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have drawn her picture with my voice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">And I prithee tell me, how dost thou find the</div>
                     <div class="line">inclination of the people, especially of the younger sort?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, they listened to me as they would have</div>
                     <div class="line">hearkened to their father's testament. There was a</div>
                     <div class="line">Spaniard's mouth so watered, that he went to bed to</div>
                     <div class="line">her very description.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall have him here to-morrow with his best ruff on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">To-night, to-night. But, mistress, do you know the</div>
                     <div class="line">French knight that cowers i' the hams?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, Monsieur Veroles?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, he: he offered to cut a caper at the</div>
                     <div class="line">proclamation; but he made a groan at it, and swore</div>
                     <div class="line">he would see her to-morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well; as for him, he brought his disease</div>
                     <div class="line">hither: here he does but repair it. I know he will</div>
                     <div class="line">come in our shadow, to scatter his crowns in the</div>
                     <div class="line">sun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, if we had of every nation a traveller, we</div>
                     <div class="line">should lodge them with this sign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To MARINA</span>  Pray you, come hither awhile. You</div>
                     <div class="line">have fortunes coming upon you. Mark me: you must</div>
                     <div class="line">seem to do that fearfully which you commit</div>
                     <div class="line">willingly, despise profit where you have most gain.</div>
                     <div class="line">To weep that you live as ye do makes pity in your</div>
                     <div class="line">lovers: seldom but that pity begets you a good</div>
                     <div class="line">opinion, and that opinion a mere profit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">I understand you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">O, take her home, mistress, take her home: these</div>
                     <div class="line">blushes of hers must be quenched with some present practise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sayest true, i' faith, so they must; for your</div>
                     <div class="line">bride goes to that with shame which is her way to go</div>
                     <div class="line">with warrant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, some do, and some do not. But, mistress, if</div>
                     <div class="line">I have bargained for the joint,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mayst cut a morsel off the spit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">I may so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Who should deny it? Come, young one, I like the</div>
                     <div class="line">manner of your garments well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, by my faith, they shall not be changed yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Bawd</div>
                     <div class="line">Boult, spend thou that in the town: report what a</div>
                     <div class="line">sojourner we have; you'll lose nothing by custom.</div>
                     <div class="line">When nature flamed this piece, she meant thee a good</div>
                     <div class="line">turn; therefore say what a paragon she is, and thou</div>
                     <div class="line">hast the harvest out of thine own report.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOULT</div>
