                     <div class="line">The king my father did in Tarsus leave me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did seek to murder me: and having woo'd</div>
                     <div class="line">A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to do't,</div>
                     <div class="line">A crew of pirates came and rescued me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Brought me to Mytilene. But, good sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither will you have me? Why do you weep?</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be,</div>
                     <div class="line">You think me an impostor: no, good faith;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the daughter to King Pericles,</div>
                     <div class="line">If good King Pericles be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ho, Helicanus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Calls my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a grave and noble counsellor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most wise in general: tell me, if thou canst,</div>
                     <div class="line">What this maid is, or what is like to be,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus hath made me weep?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not; but</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is the regent, sir, of Mytilene</div>
                     <div class="line">Speaks nobly of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSIMACHUS</div>
                     <div class="line">She would never tell</div>
                     <div class="line">Her parentage; being demanded that,</div>
                     <div class="line">She would sit still and weep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O Helicanus, strike me, honour'd sir;</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me a gash, put me to present pain;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest this great sea of joys rushing upon me</div>
                     <div class="line">O'erbear the shores of my mortality,</div>
                     <div class="line">And drown me with their sweetness. O, come hither,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou that beget'st him that did thee beget;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou that wast born at sea, buried at Tarsus,</div>
                     <div class="line">And found at sea again! O Helicanus,</div>
                     <div class="line">Down on thy knees, thank the holy gods as loud</div>
                     <div class="line">As thunder threatens us: this is Marina.</div>
                     <div class="line">What was thy mother's name? tell me but that,</div>
                     <div class="line">For truth can never be confirm'd enough,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though doubts did ever sleep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">First, sir, I pray,</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your title?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am Pericles of Tyre: but tell me now</div>
                     <div class="line">My drown'd queen's name, as in the rest you said</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast been godlike perfect,</div>
                     <div class="line">The heir of kingdoms and another like</div>
                     <div class="line">To Pericles thy father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it no more to be your daughter than</div>
                     <div class="line">To say my mother's name was Thaisa?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thaisa was my mother, who did end</div>
                     <div class="line">The minute I began.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, blessing on thee! rise; thou art my child.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me fresh garments. Mine own, Helicanus;</div>
                     <div class="line">She is not dead at Tarsus, as she should have been,</div>
                     <div class="line">By savage Cleon: she shall tell thee all;</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou shalt kneel, and justify in knowledge</div>
                     <div class="line">She is thy very princess. Who is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, 'tis the governor of Mytilene,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, hearing of your melancholy state,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did come to see you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I embrace you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my robes. I am wild in my beholding.</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens bless my girl! But, hark, what music?</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell Helicanus, my Marina, tell him</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er, point by point, for yet he seems to doubt,</div>
                     <div class="line">How sure you are my daughter. But, what music?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I hear none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">None!</div>
                     <div class="line">The music of the spheres! List, my Marina.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSIMACHUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not good to cross him; give him way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Rarest sounds! Do ye not hear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSIMACHUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Music</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Most heavenly music!</div>
                     <div class="line">It nips me unto listening, and thick slumber</div>
                     <div class="line">Hangs upon mine eyes: let me rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Sleeps</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSIMACHUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A pillow for his head:</div>
                     <div class="line">So, leave him all. Well, my companion friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">If this but answer to my just belief,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll well remember you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but PERICLES</p>
               <p>DIANA appears to PERICLES as in a vision</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">My temple stands in Ephesus: hie thee thither,</div>
                     <div class="line">And do upon mine altar sacrifice.</div>
                     <div class="line">There, when my maiden priests are met together,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the people all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Reveal how thou at sea didst lose thy wife:</div>
                     <div class="line">To mourn thy crosses, with thy daughter's, call</div>
                     <div class="line">And give them repetition to the life.</div>
                     <div class="line">Or perform my bidding, or thou livest in woe;</div>
                     <div class="line">Do it, and happy; by my silver bow!</div>
                     <div class="line">Awake, and tell thy dream.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Disappears</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Celestial Dian, goddess argentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will obey thee. Helicanus!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter HELICANUS, LYSIMACHUS, and MARINA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">My purpose was for Tarsus, there to strike</div>
                     <div class="line">The inhospitable Cleon; but I am</div>
                     <div class="line">For other service first: toward Ephesus</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn our blown sails; eftsoons I'll tell thee why.</div>
                     <p>To LYSIMACHUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Shall we refresh us, sir, upon your shore,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give you gold for such provision</div>
                     <div class="line">As our intents will need?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSIMACHUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart; and, when you come ashore,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have another suit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall prevail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were it to woo my daughter; for it seems</div>
                     <div class="line">You have been noble towards her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LYSIMACHUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, lend me your arm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, my Marina.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE II</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GOWER, before the temple of DIANA at Ephesus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOWER</div>
                     <div class="line">Now our sands are almost run;</div>
                     <div class="line">More a little, and then dumb.</div>
                     <div class="line">This, my last boon, give me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For such kindness must relieve me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you aptly will suppose</div>
                     <div class="line">What pageantry, what feats, what shows,</div>
                     <div class="line">What minstrelsy, and pretty din,</div>
                     <div class="line">The regent made in Mytilene</div>
                     <div class="line">To greet the king. So he thrived,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is promised to be wived</div>
                     <div class="line">To fair Marina; but in no wise</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he had done his sacrifice,</div>
                     <div class="line">As Dian bade: whereto being bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">The interim, pray you, all confound.</div>
                     <div class="line">In feather'd briefness sails are fill'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wishes fall out as they're will'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">At Ephesus, the temple see,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our king and all his company.</div>
                     <div class="line">That he can hither come so soon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is by your fancy's thankful doom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE III.  The temple of Diana at Ephesus; THAISA standing near the altar, as high priestess; a number of Virgins on each side; CERIMON and other Inhabitants of Ephesus attending.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PERICLES, with his train; LYSIMACHUS,
HELICANUS, MARINA, and a Lady</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, Dian! to perform thy just command,</div>
                     <div class="line">I here confess myself the king of Tyre;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, frighted from my country, did wed</div>
                     <div class="line">At Pentapolis the fair Thaisa.</div>
                     <div class="line">At sea in childbed died she, but brought forth</div>
                     <div class="line">A maid-child call'd Marina; who, O goddess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wears yet thy silver livery. She at Tarsus</div>
                     <div class="line">Was nursed with Cleon; who at fourteen years</div>
                     <div class="line">He sought to murder: but her better stars</div>
                     <div class="line">Brought her to Mytilene; 'gainst whose shore</div>
                     <div class="line">Riding, her fortunes brought the maid aboard us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, by her own most clear remembrance, she</div>
                     <div class="line">Made known herself my daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">Voice and favour!</div>
                     <div class="line">You are, you are--O royal Pericles!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Faints</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">What means the nun? she dies! help, gentlemen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you have told Diana's altar true,</div>
                     <div class="line">This is your wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Reverend appearer, no;</div>
                     <div class="line">I threw her overboard with these very arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this coast, I warrant you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis most certain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to the lady; O, she's but o'erjoy'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Early in blustering morn this lady was</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrown upon this shore. I oped the coffin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Found there rich jewels; recover'd her, and placed her</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in Diana's temple.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">May we see them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Great sir, they shall be brought you to my house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither I invite you. Look, Thaisa is recovered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me look!</div>
                     <div class="line">If he be none of mine, my sanctity</div>
                     <div class="line">Will to my sense bend no licentious ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">But curb it, spite of seeing. O, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you not Pericles? Like him you spake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like him you are: did you not name a tempest,</div>
                     <div class="line">A birth, and death?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">The voice of dead Thaisa!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">That Thaisa am I, supposed dead</div>
                     <div class="line">And drown'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Immortal Dian!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">Now I know you better.</div>
                     <div class="line">When we with tears parted Pentapolis,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king my father gave you such a ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Shows a ring</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">This, this: no more, you gods! your present kindness</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes my past miseries sports: you shall do well,</div>
                     <div class="line">That on the touching of her lips I may</div>
                     <div class="line">Melt and no more be seen. O, come, be buried</div>
                     <div class="line">A second time within these arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARINA</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Leaps to be gone into my mother's bosom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Kneels to THAISA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, who kneels here! Flesh of thy flesh, Thaisa;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy burden at the sea, and call'd Marina</div>
                     <div class="line">For she was yielded there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">Blest, and mine own!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, madam, and my queen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">You have heard me say, when I did fly from Tyre,</div>
                     <div class="line">I left behind an ancient substitute:</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you remember what I call'd the man?</div>
                     <div class="line">I have named him oft.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas Helicanus then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Still confirmation:</div>
                     <div class="line">Embrace him, dear Thaisa; this is he.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now do I long to hear how you were found;</div>
                     <div class="line">How possibly preserved; and who to thank,</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides the gods, for this great miracle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Cerimon, my lord; this man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Through whom the gods have shown their power; that can</div>
                     <div class="line">From first to last resolve you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Reverend sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods can have no mortal officer</div>
                     <div class="line">More like a god than you. Will you deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">How this dead queen re-lives?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CERIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my lord.</div>
                     <div class="line">Beseech you, first go with me to my house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where shall be shown you all was found with her;</div>
                     <div class="line">How she came placed here in the temple;</div>
                     <div class="line">No needful thing omitted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Pure Dian, bless thee for thy vision! I</div>
                     <div class="line">Will offer night-oblations to thee. Thaisa,</div>
                     <div class="line">This prince, the fair-betrothed of your daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall marry her at Pentapolis. And now,</div>
                     <div class="line">This ornament</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me look dismal will I clip to form;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what this fourteen years no razor touch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To grace thy marriage-day, I'll beautify.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Cerimon hath letters of good credit, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">My father's dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Heavens make a star of him! Yet there, my queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll celebrate their nuptials, and ourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">Will in that kingdom spend our following days:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our son and daughter shall in Tyrus reign.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Cerimon, we do our longing stay</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear the rest untold: sir, lead's the way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Enter GOWER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOWER</div>
                     <div class="line">In Antiochus and his daughter you have heard</div>
                     <div class="line">Of monstrous lust the due and just reward:</div>
                     <div class="line">In Pericles, his queen and daughter, seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although assail'd with fortune fierce and keen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue preserved from fell destruction's blast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Led on by heaven, and crown'd with joy at last:</div>
                     <div class="line">In Helicanus may you well descry</div>
                     <div class="line">A figure of truth, of faith, of loyalty:</div>
                     <div class="line">In reverend Cerimon there well appears</div>
                     <div class="line">The worth that learned charity aye wears:</div>
                     <div class="line">For wicked Cleon and his wife, when fame</div>
                     <div class="line">Had spread their cursed deed, and honour'd name</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Pericles, to rage the city turn,</div>
                     <div class="line">That him and his they in his palace burn;</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods for murder seemed so content</div>
                     <div class="line">To punish them; although not done, but meant.</div>
                     <div class="line">So, on your patience evermore attending,</div>
                     <div class="line">New joy wait on you! Here our play has ending.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

      <title>Pericles, Prince of Tyre</title>
   </head>

         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>Pericles, Prince of Tyre</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">

                           <span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE II.  The same. A public way or platform leading to the lists. A pavilion by the side of it for the reception of King, Princess, Lords, &c.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>

                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>

                           </span>

                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.8">7. SCENE VI.  The same. A room in the brothel.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. [Prologue]</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE I.  On board PERICLES' ship, off Mytilene. A close pavilion on deck, with a curtain before it; PERICLES within it, reclined on a couch. A barge lying beside the Tyrian vessel.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE II</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE III.  The temple of Diana at Ephesus; THAISA standing near the altar, as high priestess; a number of Virgins on each side; CERIMON and other Inhabitants of Ephesus attending.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ANTIOCHUS, king of Antioch.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PERICLES, prince of Tyre.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">HELICANUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">ESCANES</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">two lords of Tyre.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIMONIDES, king of Pentapolis.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CLEON, governor of Tarsus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LYSIMACHUS, governor of Mytilene.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CERIMON, a lord of Ephesus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">THALIARD, a lord of Antioch.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PHILEMON, servant to Cerimon.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LEONINE, servant to Dionyza.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Marshal. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Pandar. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BOULT, his servant.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">The Daughter of Antiochus. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DIONYZA, wife to Cleon.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">THAISA, daughter to Simonides.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MARINA, daughter to Pericles and Thaisa.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LYCHORIDA, nurse to Marina.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Bawd. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lords, Knights, Gentlemen, Sailors, Pirates, Fishermen, and Messengers. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DIANA</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">GOWER, as Chorus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Dispersedly in various countries.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. [Prologue]</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. [Prologue]</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GOWER</p>
                        <p>Before the palace of Antioch</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">[GOWER]</div>
                              <div class="line">To sing a song that old was sung,</div>
                              <div class="line">From ashes ancient Gower is come;</div>
                              <div class="line">Assuming man's infirmities,</div>
                              <div class="line">To glad your ear, and please your eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">It hath been sung at festivals,</div>
                              <div class="line">On ember-eves and holy-ales;</div>
                              <div class="line">And lords and ladies in their lives</div>
                              <div class="line">Have read it for restoratives:</div>
                              <div class="line">The purchase is to make men glorious;</div>
                              <div class="line">Et bonum quo antiquius, eo melius.</div>
                              <div class="line">If you, born in these latter times,</div>
                              <div class="line">When wit's more ripe, accept my rhymes.</div>
                              <div class="line">And that to hear an old man sing</div>
                              <div class="line">May to your wishes pleasure bring</div>
                              <div class="line">I life would wish, and that I might</div>
                              <div class="line">Waste it for you, like taper-light.</div>
                              <div class="line">This Antioch, then, Antiochus the Great</div>
                              <div class="line">Built up, this city, for his chiefest seat:</div>
                              <div class="line">The fairest in all Syria,</div>
                              <div class="line">I tell you what mine authors say:</div>
                              <div class="line">This king unto him took a fere,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who died and left a female heir,</div>
                              <div class="line">So buxom, blithe, and full of face,</div>
                              <div class="line">As heaven had lent her all his grace;</div>
                              <div class="line">With whom the father liking took,</div>
                              <div class="line">And her to incest did provoke:</div>
                              <div class="line">Bad child; worse father! to entice his own</div>
                              <div class="line">To evil should be done by none:</div>
                              <div class="line">But custom what they did begin</div>
                              <div class="line">Was with long use account no sin.</div>
                              <div class="line">The beauty of this sinful dame</div>
                              <div class="line">Made many princes thither frame,</div>
                              <div class="line">To seek her as a bed-fellow,</div>
                              <div class="line">In marriage-pleasures play-fellow:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which to prevent he made a law,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep her still, and men in awe,</div>
                              <div class="line">That whoso ask'd her for his wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">His riddle told not, lost his life:</div>
                              <div class="line">So for her many a wight did die,</div>
                              <div class="line">As yon grim looks do testify.</div>
                              <div class="line">What now ensues, to the judgment of your eye</div>
                              <div class="line">I give, my cause who best can justify.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ANTIOCHUS, Prince PERICLES, and followers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Young prince of Tyre, you have at large received</div>
                              <div class="line">The danger of the task you undertake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I have, Antiochus, and, with a soul</div>
                              <div class="line">Embolden'd with the glory of her praise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Think death no hazard in this enterprise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring in our daughter, clothed like a bride,</div>
                              <div class="line">For the embracements even of Jove himself;</div>
                              <div class="line">At whose conception, till Lucina reign'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nature this dowry gave, to glad her presence,</div>
                              <div class="line">The senate-house of planets all did sit,</div>
                              <div class="line">To knit in her their best perfections.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Music. Enter the Daughter of ANTIOCHUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">See where she comes, apparell'd like the spring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Graces her subjects, and her thoughts the king</div>
                              <div class="line">Of every virtue gives renown to men!</div>
                              <div class="line">Her face the book of praises, where is read</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing but curious pleasures, as from thence</div>
                              <div class="line">Sorrow were ever razed and testy wrath</div>
                              <div class="line">Could never be her mild companion.</div>
                              <div class="line">You gods that made me man, and sway in love,</div>
                              <div class="line">That have inflamed desire in my breast</div>
                              <div class="line">To taste the fruit of yon celestial tree,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or die in the adventure, be my helps,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I am son and servant to your will,</div>
                              <div class="line">To compass such a boundless happiness!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince Pericles,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">That would be son to great Antiochus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Before thee stands this fair Hesperides,</div>
                              <div class="line">With golden fruit, but dangerous to be touch'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">For death-like dragons here affright thee hard:</div>
                              <div class="line">Her face, like heaven, enticeth thee to view</div>
                              <div class="line">Her countless glory, which desert must gain;</div>
                              <div class="line">And which, without desert, because thine eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Presumes to reach, all thy whole heap must die.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yon sometimes famous princes, like thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Drawn by report, adventurous by desire,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell thee, with speechless tongues and semblance pale,</div>
                              <div class="line">That without covering, save yon field of stars,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here they stand martyrs, slain in Cupid's wars;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with dead cheeks advise thee to desist</div>
                              <div class="line">For going on death's net, whom none resist.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Antiochus, I thank thee, who hath taught</div>
                              <div class="line">My frail mortality to know itself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by those fearful objects to prepare</div>
                              <div class="line">This body, like to them, to what I must;</div>
                              <div class="line">For death remember'd should be like a mirror,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who tells us life's but breath, to trust it error.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll make my will then, and, as sick men do</div>
                              <div class="line">Who know the world, see heaven, but, feeling woe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gripe not at earthly joys as erst they did;</div>
                              <div class="line">So I bequeath a happy peace to you</div>
                              <div class="line">And all good men, as every prince should do;</div>
                              <div class="line">My riches to the earth from whence they came;</div>
                              <div class="line">But my unspotted fire of love to you.</div>
                              <p>To the Daughter of ANTIOCHUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Thus ready for the way of life or death,</div>
                              <div class="line">I wait the sharpest blow, Antiochus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Scorning advice, read the conclusion then:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which read and not expounded, 'tis decreed,</div>
                              <div class="line">As these before thee thou thyself shalt bleed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Daughter</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all say'd yet, mayst thou prove prosperous!</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all say'd yet, I wish thee happiness!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a bold champion, I assume the lists,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor ask advice of any other thought</div>
                              <div class="line">But faithfulness and courage.</div>
                              <p>He reads the riddle</p>
                              <div class="line">I am no viper, yet I feed</div>
                              <div class="line">On mother's flesh which did me breed.</div>
                              <div class="line">I sought a husband, in which labour</div>
                              <div class="line">I found that kindness in a father:</div>
                              <div class="line">He's father, son, and husband mild;</div>
                              <div class="line">I mother, wife, and yet his child.</div>
                              <div class="line">How they may be, and yet in two,</div>
                              <div class="line">As you will live, resolve it you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sharp physic is the last: but, O you powers</div>
                              <div class="line">That give heaven countless eyes to view men's acts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why cloud they not their sights perpetually,</div>
                              <div class="line">If this be true, which makes me pale to read it?</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair glass of light, I loved you, and could still,</div>
                              <p>Takes hold of the hand of the Daughter of ANTIOCHUS</p>
                              <div class="line">Were not this glorious casket stored with ill:</div>
                              <div class="line">But I must tell you, now my thoughts revolt</div>
                              <div class="line">For he's no man on whom perfections wait</div>
                              <div class="line">That, knowing sin within, will touch the gate.</div>
                              <div class="line">You are a fair viol, and your sense the strings;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, finger'd to make man his lawful music,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would draw heaven down, and all the gods, to hearken:</div>
                              <div class="line">But being play'd upon before your time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hell only danceth at so harsh a chime.</div>
                              <div class="line">Good sooth, I care not for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince Pericles, touch not, upon thy life.</div>
                              <div class="line">For that's an article within our law,</div>
                              <div class="line">As dangerous as the rest. Your time's expired:</div>
                              <div class="line">Either expound now, or receive your sentence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Great king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Few love to hear the sins they love to act;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twould braid yourself too near for me to tell it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who has a book of all that monarchs do,</div>
                              <div class="line">He's more secure to keep it shut than shown:</div>
                              <div class="line">For vice repeated is like the wandering wind.</div>
                              <div class="line">Blows dust in other's eyes, to spread itself;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet the end of all is bought thus dear,</div>
                              <div class="line">The breath is gone, and the sore eyes see clear:</div>
                              <div class="line">To stop the air would hurt them. The blind mole casts</div>
                              <div class="line">Copp'd hills towards heaven, to tell the earth is throng'd</div>
                              <div class="line">By man's oppression; and the poor worm doth die for't.</div>
                              <div class="line">Kings are earth's gods; in vice their law's</div>
                              <div class="line">their will;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if Jove stray, who dares say Jove doth ill?</div>
                              <div class="line">It is enough you know; and it is fit,</div>
                              <div class="line">What being more known grows worse, to smother it.</div>
                              <div class="line">All love the womb that their first being bred,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then give my tongue like leave to love my head.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Heaven, that I had thy head! he has found</div>
                              <div class="line">the meaning:</div>
                              <div class="line">But I will gloze with him.--Young prince of Tyre,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though by the tenor of our strict edict,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your exposition misinterpreting,</div>
                              <div class="line">We might proceed to cancel of your days;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet hope, succeeding from so fair a tree</div>
                              <div class="line">As your fair self, doth tune us otherwise:</div>
                              <div class="line">Forty days longer we do respite you;</div>
                              <div class="line">If by which time our secret be undone,</div>
                              <div class="line">This mercy shows we'll joy in such a son:</div>
                              <div class="line">And until then your entertain shall be</div>
                              <div class="line">As doth befit our honour and your worth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but PERICLES</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">How courtesy would seem to cover sin,</div>
                              <div class="line">When what is done is like an hypocrite,</div>
                              <div class="line">The which is good in nothing but in sight!</div>
                              <div class="line">If it be true that I interpret false,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then were it certain you were not so bad</div>
                              <div class="line">As with foul incest to abuse your soul;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where now you're both a father and a son,</div>
                              <div class="line">By your untimely claspings with your child,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which pleasure fits an husband, not a father;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she an eater of her mother's flesh,</div>
                              <div class="line">By the defiling of her parent's bed;</div>
                              <div class="line">And both like serpents are, who though they feed</div>
                              <div class="line">On sweetest flowers, yet they poison breed.</div>
                              <div class="line">Antioch, farewell! for wisdom sees, those men</div>
                              <div class="line">Blush not in actions blacker than the night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will shun no course to keep them from the light.</div>
                              <div class="line">One sin, I know, another doth provoke;</div>
                              <div class="line">Murder's as near to lust as flame to smoke:</div>
                              <div class="line">Poison and treason are the hands of sin,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and the targets, to put off the shame:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, lest my lie be cropp'd to keep you clear,</div>
                              <div class="line">By flight I'll shun the danger which I fear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Re-enter ANTIOCHUS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath found the meaning, for which we mean</div>
                              <div class="line">To have his head.</div>
                              <div class="line">He must not live to trumpet forth my infamy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor tell the world Antiochus doth sin</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a loathed manner;</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore instantly this prince must die:</div>
                              <div class="line">For by his fall my honour must keep high.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who attends us there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter THALIARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth your highness call?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thaliard,</div>
                              <div class="line">You are of our chamber, and our mind partakes</div>
                              <div class="line">Her private actions to your secrecy;</div>
                              <div class="line">And for your faithfulness we will advance you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thaliard, behold, here's poison, and here's gold;</div>
                              <div class="line">We hate the prince of Tyre, and thou must kill him:</div>
                              <div class="line">It fits thee not to ask the reason why,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because we bid it. Say, is it done?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Enough.</div>
                              <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                              <div class="line">Let your breath cool yourself, telling your haste.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, prince Pericles is fled.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt live, fly after: and like an arrow shot</div>
                              <div class="line">From a well-experienced archer hits the mark</div>
                              <div class="line">His eye doth level at, so thou ne'er return</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless thou say 'Prince Pericles is dead.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I can get him within my pistol's length,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll make him sure enough: so, farewell to your highness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIOCHUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Thaliard, adieu!</div>
                              <p>Exit THALIARD</p>
                              <div class="line">Till Pericles be dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart can lend no succor to my head.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PERICLES</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To Lords without</span>  Let none disturb us.--Why should</div>
                              <div class="line">this change of thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">The sad companion, dull-eyed melancholy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be my so used a guest as not an hour,</div>
                              <div class="line">In the day's glorious walk, or peaceful night,</div>
                              <div class="line">The tomb where grief should sleep, can breed me quiet?</div>
                              <div class="line">Here pleasures court mine eyes, and mine eyes shun them,</div>
                              <div class="line">And danger, which I fear'd, is at Antioch,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose aim seems far too short to hit me here:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet neither pleasure's art can joy my spirits,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor yet the other's distance comfort me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then it is thus: the passions of the mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">That have their first conception by mis-dread,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have after-nourishment and life by care;</div>
                              <div class="line">And what was first but fear what might be done,</div>
                              <div class="line">Grows elder now and cares it be not done.</div>
                              <div class="line">And so with me: the great Antiochus,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Gainst whom I am too little to contend,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since he's so great can make his will his act,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will think me speaking, though I swear to silence;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor boots it me to say I honour him.</div>
                              <div class="line">If he suspect I may dishonour him:</div>
                              <div class="line">And what may make him blush in being known,</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll stop the course by which it might be known;</div>
                              <div class="line">With hostile forces he'll o'erspread the land,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with the ostent of war will look so huge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Amazement shall drive courage from the state;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our men be vanquish'd ere they do resist,</div>
                              <div class="line">And subjects punish'd that ne'er thought offence:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which care of them, not pity of myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who am no more but as the tops of trees,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which fence the roots they grow by and defend them,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes both my body pine and soul to languish,</div>
                              <div class="line">And punish that before that he would punish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter HELICANUS, with other Lords</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Joy and all comfort in your sacred breast!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep your mind, till you return to us,</div>
                              <div class="line">Peaceful and comfortable!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, peace, and give experience tongue.</div>
                              <div class="line">They do abuse the king that flatter him:</div>
                              <div class="line">For flattery is the bellows blows up sin;</div>
                              <div class="line">The thing which is flatter'd, but a spark,</div>
                              <div class="line">To which that blast gives heat and stronger glowing;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereas reproof, obedient and in order,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fits kings, as they are men, for they may err.</div>
                              <div class="line">When Signior Sooth here does proclaim a peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">He flatters you, makes war upon your life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince, pardon me, or strike me, if you please;</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot be much lower than my knees.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">All leave us else; but let your cares o'erlook</div>
                              <div class="line">What shipping and what lading's in our haven,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then return to us.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt Lords</p>
                              <div class="line">Helicanus, thou</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast moved us: what seest thou in our looks?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">An angry brow, dread lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">If there be such a dart in princes' frowns,</div>
                              <div class="line">How durst thy tongue move anger to our face?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">How dare the plants look up to heaven, from whence</div>
                              <div class="line">They have their nourishment?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou know'st I have power</div>
                              <div class="line">To take thy life from thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Kneeling</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">I have ground the axe myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you but strike the blow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Rise, prithee, rise.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sit down: thou art no flatterer:</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee for it; and heaven forbid</div>
                              <div class="line">That kings should let their ears hear their</div>
                              <div class="line">faults hid!</div>
                              <div class="line">Fit counsellor and servant for a prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who by thy wisdom makest a prince thy servant,</div>
                              <div class="line">What wouldst thou have me do?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear with patience</div>
                              <div class="line">Such griefs as you yourself do lay upon yourself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou speak'st like a physician, Helicanus,</div>
                              <div class="line">That minister'st a potion unto me</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou wouldst tremble to receive thyself.</div>
                              <div class="line">Attend me, then: I went to Antioch,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where as thou know'st, against the face of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">I sought the purchase of a glorious beauty.</div>
                              <div class="line">From whence an issue I might propagate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are arms to princes, and bring joys to subjects.</div>
                              <div class="line">Her face was to mine eye beyond all wonder;</div>
                              <div class="line">The rest--hark in thine ear--as black as incest:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which by my knowledge found, the sinful father</div>
                              <div class="line">Seem'd not to strike, but smooth: but thou</div>
                              <div class="line">know'st this,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis time to fear when tyrants seem to kiss.</div>
                              <div class="line">Such fear so grew in me, I hither fled,</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the covering of a careful night,</div>
