                              <div class="line">Who seem'd my good protector; and, being here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bethought me what was past, what might succeed.</div>
                              <div class="line">I knew him tyrannous; and tyrants' fears</div>
                              <div class="line">Decrease not, but grow faster than the years:</div>
                              <div class="line">And should he doubt it, as no doubt he doth,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I should open to the listening air</div>
                              <div class="line">How many worthy princes' bloods were shed,</div>
                              <div class="line">To keep his bed of blackness unlaid ope,</div>
                              <div class="line">To lop that doubt, he'll fill this land with arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make pretence of wrong that I have done him:</div>
                              <div class="line">When all, for mine, if I may call offence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must feel war's blow, who spares not innocence:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which love to all, of which thyself art one,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who now reprovest me for it,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, sir!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Drew sleep out of mine eyes, blood from my cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Musings into my mind, with thousand doubts</div>
                              <div class="line">How I might stop this tempest ere it came;</div>
                              <div class="line">And finding little comfort to relieve them,</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought it princely charity to grieve them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, my lord, since you have given me leave to speak.</div>
                              <div class="line">Freely will I speak. Antiochus you fear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And justly too, I think, you fear the tyrant,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who either by public war or private treason</div>
                              <div class="line">Will take away your life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, my lord, go travel for a while,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till that his rage and anger be forgot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or till the Destinies do cut his thread of life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your rule direct to any; if to me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Day serves not light more faithful than I'll be.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not doubt thy faith;</div>
                              <div class="line">But should he wrong my liberties in my absence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll mingle our bloods together in the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">From whence we had our being and our birth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Tyre, I now look from thee then, and to Tarsus</div>
                              <div class="line">Intend my travel, where I'll hear from thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">And by whose letters I'll dispose myself.</div>
                              <div class="line">The care I had and have of subjects' good</div>
                              <div class="line">On thee I lay whose wisdom's strength can bear it.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll take thy word for faith, not ask thine oath:</div>
                              <div class="line">Who shuns not to break one will sure crack both:</div>
                              <div class="line">But in our orbs we'll live so round and safe,</div>
                              <div class="line">That time of both this truth shall ne'er convince,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou show'dst a subject's shine, I a true prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter THALIARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">So, this is Tyre, and this the court. Here must I</div>
                              <div class="line">kill King Pericles; and if I do it not, I am sure to</div>
                              <div class="line">be hanged at home: 'tis dangerous. Well, I perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">he was a wise fellow, and had good discretion, that,</div>
                              <div class="line">being bid to ask what he would of the king, desired</div>
                              <div class="line">he might know none of his secrets: now do I see he</div>
                              <div class="line">had some reason for't; for if a king bid a man be a</div>
                              <div class="line">villain, he's bound by the indenture of his oath to</div>
                              <div class="line">be one! Hush! here come the lords of Tyre.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter HELICANUS and ESCANES, with other Lords of Tyre</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall not need, my fellow peers of Tyre,</div>
                              <div class="line">Further to question me of your king's departure:</div>
                              <div class="line">His seal'd commission, left in trust with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth speak sufficiently he's gone to travel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  How! the king gone!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">If further yet you will be satisfied,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, as it were unlicensed of your loves,</div>
                              <div class="line">He would depart, I'll give some light unto you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Being at Antioch--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>          What from Antioch?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Royal Antiochus--on what cause I know not--</div>
                              <div class="line">Took some displeasure at him; at least he judged so:</div>
                              <div class="line">And doubting lest that he had err'd or sinn'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">To show his sorrow, he'ld correct himself;</div>
                              <div class="line">So puts himself unto the shipman's toil,</div>
                              <div class="line">With whom each minute threatens life or death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Well, I perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall not be hang'd now, although I would;</div>
                              <div class="line">But since he's gone, the king's seas must please:</div>
                              <div class="line">He 'scaped the land, to perish at the sea.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll present myself. Peace to the lords of Tyre!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Thaliard from Antiochus is welcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THALIARD</div>
                              <div class="line">From him I come</div>
                              <div class="line">With message unto princely Pericles;</div>
                              <div class="line">But since my landing I have understood</div>
                              <div class="line">Your lord has betook himself to unknown travels,</div>
                              <div class="line">My message must return from whence it came.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELICANUS</div>
                              <div class="line">We have no reason to desire it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Commended to our master, not to us:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, ere you shall depart, this we desire,</div>
                              <div class="line">As friends to Antioch, we may feast in Tyre.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CLEON, the governor of Tarsus, with DIONYZA,
and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">My Dionyza, shall we rest us here,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by relating tales of others' griefs,</div>
                              <div class="line">See if 'twill teach us to forget our own?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                              <div class="line">That were to blow at fire in hope to quench it;</div>
                              <div class="line">For who digs hills because they do aspire</div>
                              <div class="line">Throws down one mountain to cast up a higher.</div>
                              <div class="line">O my distressed lord, even such our griefs are;</div>
                              <div class="line">Here they're but felt, and seen with mischief's eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">But like to groves, being topp'd, they higher rise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">O Dionyza,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who wanteth food, and will not say he wants it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or can conceal his hunger till he famish?</div>
                              <div class="line">Our tongues and sorrows do sound deep</div>
                              <div class="line">Our woes into the air; our eyes do weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till tongues fetch breath that may proclaim them louder;</div>
                              <div class="line">That, if heaven slumber while their creatures want,</div>
                              <div class="line">They may awake their helps to comfort them.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll then discourse our woes, felt several years,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wanting breath to speak help me with tears.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll do my best, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">This Tarsus, o'er which I have the government,</div>
                              <div class="line">A city on whom plenty held full hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">For riches strew'd herself even in the streets;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose towers bore heads so high they kiss'd the clouds,</div>
                              <div class="line">And strangers ne'er beheld but wondered at;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose men and dames so jetted and adorn'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like one another's glass to trim them by:</div>
                              <div class="line">Their tables were stored full, to glad the sight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not so much to feed on as delight;</div>
                              <div class="line">All poverty was scorn'd, and pride so great,</div>
                              <div class="line">The name of help grew odious to repeat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'tis too true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">But see what heaven can do! By this our change,</div>
                              <div class="line">These mouths, who but of late, earth, sea, and air,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were all too little to content and please,</div>
                              <div class="line">Although they gave their creatures in abundance,</div>
                              <div class="line">As houses are defiled for want of use,</div>
                              <div class="line">They are now starved for want of exercise:</div>
                              <div class="line">Those palates who, not yet two summers younger,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must have inventions to delight the taste,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would now be glad of bread, and beg for it:</div>
                              <div class="line">Those mothers who, to nousle up their babes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thought nought too curious, are ready now</div>
                              <div class="line">To eat those little darlings whom they loved.</div>
                              <div class="line">So sharp are hunger's teeth, that man and wife</div>
                              <div class="line">Draw lots who first shall die to lengthen life:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here stands a lord, and there a lady weeping;</div>
                              <div class="line">Here many sink, yet those which see them fall</div>
                              <div class="line">Have scarce strength left to give them burial.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not this true?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DIONYZA</div>
                              <div class="line">Our cheeks and hollow eyes do witness it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let those cities that of plenty's cup</div>
                              <div class="line">And her prosperities so largely taste,</div>
                              <div class="line">With their superfluous riots, hear these tears!</div>
                              <div class="line">The misery of Tarsus may be theirs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Lord</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's the lord governor?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">Here.</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak out thy sorrows which thou bring'st in haste,</div>
                              <div class="line">For comfort is too far for us to expect.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">We have descried, upon our neighbouring shore,</div>
                              <div class="line">A portly sail of ships make hitherward.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought as much.</div>
                              <div class="line">One sorrow never comes but brings an heir,</div>
                              <div class="line">That may succeed as his inheritor;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so in ours: some neighbouring nation,</div>
                              <div class="line">Taking advantage of our misery,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath stuff'd these hollow vessels with their power,</div>
                              <div class="line">To beat us down, the which are down already;</div>
                              <div class="line">And make a conquest of unhappy me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereas no glory's got to overcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">That's the least fear; for, by the semblance</div>
                              <div class="line">Of their white flags display'd, they bring us peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And come to us as favourers, not as foes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou speak'st like him's untutor'd to repeat:</div>
                              <div class="line">Who makes the fairest show means most deceit.</div>
                              <div class="line">But bring they what they will and what they can,</div>
                              <div class="line">What need we fear?</div>
                              <div class="line">The ground's the lowest, and we are half way there.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go tell their general we attend him here,</div>
                              <div class="line">To know for what he comes, and whence he comes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And what he craves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">I go, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome is peace, if he on peace consist;</div>
                              <div class="line">If wars, we are unable to resist.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PERICLES with Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord governor, for so we hear you are,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not our ships and number of our men</div>
                              <div class="line">Be like a beacon fired to amaze your eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">We have heard your miseries as far as Tyre,</div>
                              <div class="line">And seen the desolation of your streets:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor come we to add sorrow to your tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">But to relieve them of their heavy load;</div>
                              <div class="line">And these our ships, you happily may think</div>
                              <div class="line">Are like the Trojan horse was stuff'd within</div>
                              <div class="line">With bloody veins, expecting overthrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are stored with corn to make your needy bread,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give them life whom hunger starved half dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">The gods of Greece protect you!</div>
                              <div class="line">And we'll pray for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Arise, I pray you, rise:</div>
                              <div class="line">We do not look for reverence, but to love,</div>
                              <div class="line">And harbourage for ourself, our ships, and men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLEON</div>
                              <div class="line">The which when any shall not gratify,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or pay you with unthankfulness in thought,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it our wives, our children, or ourselves,</div>
                              <div class="line">The curse of heaven and men succeed their evils!</div>
                              <div class="line">Till when,--the which I hope shall ne'er be seen,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace is welcome to our town and us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Which welcome we'll accept; feast here awhile,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until our stars that frown lend us a smile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. [Prologue]</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE II.  The same. A public way or platform leading to the lists. A pavilion by the side of it for the reception of King, Princess, Lords, &c.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. [Prologue]</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GOWER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOWER</div>
                              <div class="line">Here have you seen a mighty king</div>
                              <div class="line">His child, I wis, to incest bring;</div>
                              <div class="line">A better prince and benign lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">That will prove awful both in deed and word.</div>
                              <div class="line">Be quiet then as men should be,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till he hath pass'd necessity.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll show you those in troubles reign,</div>
                              <div class="line">Losing a mite, a mountain gain.</div>
                              <div class="line">The good in conversation,</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom I give my benison,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is still at Tarsus, where each man</div>
                              <div class="line">Thinks all is writ he speken can;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, to remember what he does,</div>
                              <div class="line">Build his statue to make him glorious:</div>
                              <div class="line">But tidings to the contrary</div>
                              <div class="line">Are brought your eyes; what need speak I?</div>
                              <h3 class="bridgehead">DUMB SHOW.</h3>
                              <p>Enter at one door PERICLES talking with CLEON; all
the train with them. Enter at another door a
Gentleman, with a letter to PERICLES; PERICLES
shows the letter to CLEON; gives the Messenger a
reward, and knights him. Exit PERICLES at one
door, and CLEON at another</p>
                              <div class="line">Good Helicane, that stay'd at home,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to eat honey like a drone</div>
                              <div class="line">From others' labours; for though he strive</div>
                              <div class="line">To killen bad, keep good alive;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to fulfil his prince' desire,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sends word of all that haps in Tyre:</div>
                              <div class="line">How Thaliard came full bent with sin</div>
                              <div class="line">And had intent to murder him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that in Tarsus was not best</div>
                              <div class="line">Longer for him to make his rest.</div>
                              <div class="line">He, doing so, put forth to seas,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where when men been, there's seldom ease;</div>
                              <div class="line">For now the wind begins to blow;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thunder above and deeps below</div>
                              <div class="line">Make such unquiet, that the ship</div>
                              <div class="line">Should house him safe is wreck'd and split;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he, good prince, having all lost,</div>
                              <div class="line">By waves from coast to coast is tost:</div>
                              <div class="line">All perishen of man, of pelf,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ne aught escapen but himself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Till fortune, tired with doing bad,</div>
                              <div class="line">Threw him ashore, to give him glad:</div>
                              <div class="line">And here he comes. What shall be next,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon old Gower,--this longs the text.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PERICLES, wet</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet cease your ire, you angry stars of heaven!</div>
                              <div class="line">Wind, rain, and thunder, remember, earthly man</div>
                              <div class="line">Is but a substance that must yield to you;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, as fits my nature, do obey you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, the sea hath cast me on the rocks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wash'd me from shore to shore, and left me breath</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing to think on but ensuing death:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it suffice the greatness of your powers</div>
                              <div class="line">To have bereft a prince of all his fortunes;</div>
                              <div class="line">And having thrown him from your watery grave,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here to have death in peace is all he'll crave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter three FISHERMEN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">What, ho, Pilch!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha, come and bring away the nets!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">What, Patch-breech, I say!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">What say you, master?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Look how thou stirrest now! come away, or I'll</div>
                              <div class="line">fetch thee with a wanion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, master, I am thinking of the poor men that</div>
                              <div class="line">were cast away before us even now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor souls, it grieved my heart to hear what</div>
                              <div class="line">pitiful cries they made to us to help them, when,</div>
                              <div class="line">well-a-day, we could scarce help ourselves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, master, said not I as much when I saw the</div>
                              <div class="line">porpus how he bounced and tumbled? they say</div>
                              <div class="line">they're half fish, half flesh: a plague on them,</div>
                              <div class="line">they ne'er come but I look to be washed. Master, I</div>
                              <div class="line">marvel how the fishes live in the sea.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, as men do a-land; the great ones eat up the</div>
                              <div class="line">little ones: I can compare our rich misers to</div>
                              <div class="line">nothing so fitly as to a whale; a' plays and</div>
                              <div class="line">tumbles, driving the poor fry before him, and at</div>
                              <div class="line">last devours them all at a mouthful: such whales</div>
                              <div class="line">have I heard on o' the land, who never leave gaping</div>
                              <div class="line">till they've swallowed the whole parish, church,</div>
                              <div class="line">steeple, bells, and all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  A pretty moral.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">But, master, if I had been the sexton, I would have</div>
                              <div class="line">been that day in the belfry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, man?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Because he should have swallowed me too: and when I</div>
                              <div class="line">had been in his belly, I would have kept such a</div>
                              <div class="line">jangling of the bells, that he should never have</div>
                              <div class="line">left, till he cast bells, steeple, church, and</div>
                              <div class="line">parish up again. But if the good King Simonides</div>
                              <div class="line">were of my mind,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Simonides!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">We would purge the land of these drones, that rob</div>
                              <div class="line">the bee of her honey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  How from the finny subject of the sea</div>
                              <div class="line">These fishers tell the infirmities of men;</div>
                              <div class="line">And from their watery empire recollect</div>
                              <div class="line">All that may men approve or men detect!</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace be at your labour, honest fishermen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Honest! good fellow, what's that? If it be a day</div>
                              <div class="line">fits you, search out of the calendar, and nobody</div>
                              <div class="line">look after it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">May see the sea hath cast upon your coast.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">What a drunken knave was the sea to cast thee in our</div>
                              <div class="line">way!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">A man whom both the waters and the wind,</div>
                              <div class="line">In that vast tennis-court, have made the ball</div>
                              <div class="line">For them to play upon, entreats you pity him:</div>
                              <div class="line">He asks of you, that never used to beg.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">No, friend, cannot you beg? Here's them in our</div>
                              <div class="line">country Greece gets more with begging than we can do</div>
                              <div class="line">with working.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Canst thou catch any fishes, then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I never practised it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, then thou wilt starve, sure; for here's nothing</div>
                              <div class="line">to be got now-a-days, unless thou canst fish for't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What I have been I have forgot to know;</div>
                              <div class="line">But what I am, want teaches me to think on:</div>
                              <div class="line">A man throng'd up with cold: my veins are chill,</div>
                              <div class="line">And have no more of life than may suffice</div>
                              <div class="line">To give my tongue that heat to ask your help;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which if you shall refuse, when I am dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">For that I am a man, pray see me buried.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Die quoth-a? Now gods forbid! I have a gown here;</div>
                              <div class="line">come, put it on; keep thee warm. Now, afore me, a</div>
                              <div class="line">handsome fellow! Come, thou shalt go home, and</div>
                              <div class="line">we'll have flesh for holidays, fish for</div>
                              <div class="line">fasting-days, and moreo'er puddings and flap-jacks,</div>
                              <div class="line">and thou shalt be welcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark you, my friend; you said you could not beg.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I did but crave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">But crave! Then I'll turn craver too, and so I</div>
                              <div class="line">shall 'scape whipping.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, are all your beggars whipped, then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">O, not all, my friend, not all; for if all your</div>
                              <div class="line">beggars were whipped, I would wish no better office</div>
                              <div class="line">than to be beadle. But, master, I'll go draw up the</div>
                              <div class="line">net.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit with Third Fisherman</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  How well this honest mirth becomes their labour!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark you, sir, do you know where ye are?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Not well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, I'll tell you: this is called Pentapolis, and</div>
                              <div class="line">our king the good Simonides.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">The good King Simonides, do you call him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, sir; and he deserves so to be called for his</div>
                              <div class="line">peaceable reign and good government.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">He is a happy king, since he gains from his subjects</div>
                              <div class="line">the name of good by his government. How far is his</div>
                              <div class="line">court distant from this shore?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, sir, half a day's journey: and I'll tell</div>
                              <div class="line">you, he hath a fair daughter, and to-morrow is her</div>
                              <div class="line">birth-day; and there are princes and knights come</div>
                              <div class="line">from all parts of the world to just and tourney for her love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Were my fortunes equal to my desires, I could wish</div>
                              <div class="line">to make one there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">O, sir, things must be as they may; and what a man</div>
                              <div class="line">cannot get, he may lawfully deal for--his wife's soul.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter Second and Third Fishermen, drawing up a net</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Help, master, help! here's a fish hangs in the net,</div>
                              <div class="line">like a poor man's right in the law; 'twill hardly</div>
                              <div class="line">come out. Ha! bots on't, 'tis come at last, and</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis turned to a rusty armour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">An armour, friends! I pray you, let me see it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, fortune, yet, that, after all my crosses,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou givest me somewhat to repair myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">And though it was mine own, part of my heritage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which my dead father did bequeath to me.</div>
                              <div class="line">With this strict charge, even as he left his life,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Keep it, my Pericles; it hath been a shield</div>
                              <div class="line">Twixt me and death;'--and pointed to this brace;--</div>
                              <div class="line">'For that it saved me, keep it; in like necessity--</div>
                              <div class="line">The which the gods protect thee from!--may</div>
                              <div class="line">defend thee.'</div>
                              <div class="line">It kept where I kept, I so dearly loved it;</div>
                              <div class="line">Till the rough seas, that spare not any man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Took it in rage, though calm'd have given't again:</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee for't: my shipwreck now's no ill,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I have here my father's gift in's will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">What mean you, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">To beg of you, kind friends, this coat of worth,</div>
                              <div class="line">For it was sometime target to a king;</div>
                              <div class="line">I know it by this mark. He loved me dearly,</div>
                              <div class="line">And for his sake I wish the having of it;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that you'ld guide me to your sovereign's court,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where with it I may appear a gentleman;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if that ever my low fortune's better,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll pay your bounties; till then rest your debtor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, wilt thou tourney for the lady?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll show the virtue I have borne in arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, do 'e take it, and the gods give thee good on't!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but hark you, my friend; 'twas we that made up</div>
                              <div class="line">this garment through the rough seams of the waters:</div>
                              <div class="line">there are certain condolements, certain vails. I</div>
                              <div class="line">hope, sir, if you thrive, you'll remember from</div>
                              <div class="line">whence you had it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe 't, I will.</div>
                              <div class="line">By your furtherance I am clothed in steel;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, spite of all the rapture of the sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">This jewel holds his building on my arm:</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto thy value I will mount myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon a courser, whose delightful steps</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall make the gazer joy to see him tread.</div>
                              <div class="line">Only, my friend, I yet am unprovided</div>
                              <div class="line">Of a pair of bases.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Fisherman</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll sure provide: thou shalt have my best gown to</div>
                              <div class="line">make thee a pair; and I'll bring thee to the court myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Then honour be but a goal to my will,</div>
                              <div class="line">This day I'll rise, or else add ill to ill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE II.  The same. A public way or platform leading to the lists. A pavilion by the side of it for the reception of King, Princess, Lords, &c.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SIMONIDES, THAISA, Lords, and Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Are the knights ready to begin the triumph?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">They are, my liege;</div>
                              <div class="line">And stay your coming to present themselves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Return them, we are ready; and our daughter,</div>
                              <div class="line">In honour of whose birth these triumphs are,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sits here, like beauty's child, whom nature gat</div>
                              <div class="line">For men to see, and seeing wonder at.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit a Lord</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">It pleaseth you, my royal father, to express</div>
                              <div class="line">My commendations great, whose merit's less.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">It's fit it should be so; for princes are</div>
                              <div class="line">A model which heaven makes like to itself:</div>
                              <div class="line">As jewels lose their glory if neglected,</div>
                              <div class="line">So princes their renowns if not respected.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis now your honour, daughter, to explain</div>
                              <div class="line">The labour of each knight in his device.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, to preserve mine honour, I'll perform.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Knight; he passes over, and his Squire
presents his shield to the Princess</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Who is the first that doth prefer himself?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">A knight of Sparta, my renowned father;</div>
                              <div class="line">And the device he bears upon his shield</div>
                              <div class="line">Is a black Ethiope reaching at the sun</div>
                              <div class="line">The word, 'Lux tua vita mihi.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">He loves you well that holds his life of you.</div>
                              <p>The Second Knight passes over</p>
                              <div class="line">Who is the second that presents himself?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">A prince of Macedon, my royal father;</div>
                              <div class="line">And the device he bears upon his shield</div>
                              <div class="line">Is an arm'd knight that's conquer'd by a lady;</div>
                              <div class="line">The motto thus, in Spanish, 'Piu por dulzura que por fuerza.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Third Knight passes over</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">And what's the third?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">The third of Antioch;</div>
                              <div class="line">And his device, a wreath of chivalry;</div>
                              <div class="line">The word, 'Me pompae provexit apex.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Fourth Knight passes over</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the fourth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">A burning torch that's turned upside down;</div>
                              <div class="line">The word, 'Quod me alit, me extinguit.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Which shows that beauty hath his power and will,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which can as well inflame as it can kill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Fifth Knight passes over</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">The fifth, an hand environed with clouds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Holding out gold that's by the touchstone tried;</div>
                              <div class="line">The motto thus, 'Sic spectanda fides.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Sixth Knight, PERICLES, passes over</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">And what's</div>
                              <div class="line">The sixth and last, the which the knight himself</div>
                              <div class="line">With such a graceful courtesy deliver'd?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">He seems to be a stranger; but his present is</div>
                              <div class="line">A wither'd branch, that's only green at top;</div>
                              <div class="line">The motto, 'In hac spe vivo.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">A pretty moral;</div>
                              <div class="line">From the dejected state wherein he is,</div>
                              <div class="line">He hopes by you his fortunes yet may flourish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">He had need mean better than his outward show</div>
                              <div class="line">Can any way speak in his just commend;</div>
                              <div class="line">For by his rusty outside he appears</div>
                              <div class="line">To have practised more the whipstock than the lance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">He well may be a stranger, for he comes</div>
                              <div class="line">To an honour'd triumph strangely furnished.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                              <div class="line">And on set purpose let his armour rust</div>
                              <div class="line">Until this day, to scour it in the dust.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Opinion's but a fool, that makes us scan</div>
                              <div class="line">The outward habit by the inward man.</div>
                              <div class="line">But stay, the knights are coming: we will withdraw</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the gallery.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Great shouts within and all cry 'The mean knight!'</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SIMONIDES, THAISA, Lords, Attendants, and
Knights, from tilting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Knights,</div>
                              <div class="line">To say you're welcome were superfluous.</div>
                              <div class="line">To place upon the volume of your deeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">As in a title-page, your worth in arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were more than you expect, or more than's fit,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since every worth in show commends itself.</div>
                              <div class="line">Prepare for mirth, for mirth becomes a feast:</div>
                              <div class="line">You are princes and my guests.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">THAISA</div>
                              <div class="line">But you, my knight and guest;</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom this wreath of victory I give,</div>
                              <div class="line">And crown you king of this day's happiness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PERICLES</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis more by fortune, lady, than by merit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Call it by what you will, the day is yours;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here, I hope, is none that envies it.</div>
                              <div class="line">In framing an artist, art hath thus decreed,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make some good, but others to exceed;</div>
                              <div class="line">And you are her labour'd scholar. Come, queen o'</div>
                              <div class="line">the feast,--</div>
                              <div class="line">For, daughter, so you are,--here take your place:</div>
                              <div class="line">Marshal the rest, as they deserve their grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KNIGHTS</div>
                              <div class="line">We are honour'd much by good Simonides.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SIMONIDES</div>
                              <div class="line">Your presence glads our days: honour we love;</div>
                              <div class="line">For who hates honour hates the gods above.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
